comments.author: github-actions[bot]
comments.body:
<!-- dignified-code-simplifier-review -->

## ✅ Dignified Code Simplifier Review

**Last updated:** 2026-02-22 01:23:24 PT

No violations detected. All changes follow dignified-python standards.

### Patterns Checked
✅ LBYL pattern (Look Before You Leap) - Proper condition checks before operations
✅ Imports - All absolute imports, properly organized with no relative imports
✅ Exception handling - Discriminated union pattern with isinstance checks, CLI-level boundaries with SystemExit
✅ Error handling - Proper use of PRNotFound discriminated union type
✅ Type annotations - Consistent use of modern type syntax (int | None, str | None)
✅ O(1) properties - Not applicable (no new properties)
✅ Max indentation depth - All functions within 4-level limit
✅ Helper function organization - Test helper _make_pr_details well-structured with sensible defaults
✅ JSON output handling - Explicit dict construction for output, clear field mapping

### Files Reviewed
- `src/erk/cli/commands/exec/scripts/get_pr_view.py`: 0 violations
- `tests/unit/cli/commands/exec/scripts/test_get_pr_view.py`: 0 violations
- `.claude/commands/erk/git-pr-push.md`: 0 violations (documentation update)

- `.claude/skills/pr-feedback-classifier/SKILL.md`: 0 violations (documentation update)
- `src/erk/cli/commands/exec/group.py`: 0 violations (import registration)

---

### Activity Log
- **2026-02-22 01:23:24 PT**: Reviewed PR #7793 - no violations detected (proper LBYL pattern, discriminated union error handling, CLI-level exception boundaries, absolute imports, well-structured tests)
- **2026-02-22 01:11:07 PT**: Reviewed PR #7793 - no violations detected (proper LBYL, helper extraction, CLI-level exception boundaries, TYPE_CHECKING imports)
- **2026-02-22 01:10:48 PT**: Reviewed PR #7793 changes - all code adheres to dignified-python standards (proper LBYL, helper extraction, CLI-level exception boundaries)
- **2026-02-21 17:09:13 PT**: Reviewed all changes - no violations detected (LBYL pattern correct, imports absolute, test helper defaults appropriate)

## ✅ Tripwires Review

**Last updated:** 2026-02-22 01:25:27 PT

No violations found. All code follows erk coding standards and tripwire rules.

- **CLI tripwires** → loaded docs/learned/cli/tripwires.md
- **Testing tripwires** → loaded docs/learned/testing/tripwires.md
- **Commands tripwires** → loaded docs/learned/commands/tripwires.md

### Tier 1 Pattern Matches (Mechanical)
✅ `@patch|monkeypatch\.` - None found
✅ `Path\.home\(\)` - None found
✅ `monkeypatch\.setattr.*Path\.home|monkeypatch.*subprocess\.run` - None found
✅ `monkeypatch\.chdir\(\)` - None found

### Tier 2 Semantic Matches
✅ **Using Path.cwd() or Path.home() in exec scripts** - None found (uses require_cwd/require_repo_root)
✅ **Using RuntimeError for expected CLI failures** - None found (uses raise SystemExit)
✅ **Using sys.exit() in internal functions** - None found (uses raise SystemExit correctly)
✅ **Adding exec script without updating reference docs** - Compliant (.claude/skills/erk-exec/reference.md updated)
✅ **Adding exec script without registering in exec group** - Compliant (registered in group.py)
✅ **Using monkeypatch in tests** - None found (uses gateway fakes)
✅ **Using discriminated unions** - Compliant (uses isinstance() checks)
✅ **Click option defaults** - Compliant (uses default=None)

### Violations Summary
None
